text:
<@URB31QKM4> -For my clients, I do a combo of qualitative data (interviews with customers), social listening, and SEO then it's basically your process. 

Filter all that together and in a spreadsheet create blog topics, provide links to the top 3 pieces to beat, and upgrades or downloadables for pieces. I provide the strategy in a topic cluster format, so each quarter is focused on certain keywords then the blog posts go into the long tail keywords. 
Then the briefs are prepared.

This gives my clients a ready made strategy for a quarter's worth of content that they can then hire writers to execute (or hire me to execute).

text:
Yes <@U0105JEFJ1F> that’s pretty similar to our process for internal SME contributors. It depends on the topic and their comfort level with writing and can range from our team ghostwriting, to the process Intercom mentions. 

<@UL1D307FB> I love the focus on adding upgrades or downloadables to the blog post ideas. We plan gated content as part of the same process I mentioned but are planning to ramp up in the coming months and tighter alignment to blog content will be :ok_hand:
